quotes.quote: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I'm not lazy, I'm just on my coffee break.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you're also the murderer.
quotes.author: Filipe Fortes

quotes.quote: There are only 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary and those who don't.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why do programmers always mix up Christmas and Halloween? Because Oct 31 == Dec 25!
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I don't always test my code, but when I do, I do it in production.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Knock, knock. Race condition. Who's there?
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I have a joke on programming, but it only works on my machine.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light mode is for Sith Lords.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: There's no place like 127.0.0.1.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why did the programmer go broke? Because he lost his domain in a bet.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do programmers prefer iOS development? Because it's a byte-sized opportunity.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables, and asks... 'Can I join you?'
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why did the developer go broke? Because he couldn't find a back-end to support him.

Why do JavaScript developers prefer dark mode? Because they like to code with a dark sense of humor.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: There's no place like 127.0.0.1 when you're a JavaScript developer.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why did the JavaScript function go broke? Because it lost its context.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer async/await? Because they enjoy the suspense.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: A JavaScript function walks into a bar, walks up to 'undefined' and asks... 'Can I bind you?'
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer arrow functions? Because they never lose their 'this'.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I asked the JavaScript interpreter why I had a TypeError. It replied, 'You're not my type.'
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer coffee? Because it helps them handle all the Java errors.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I'm not lazy, I'm just using JavaScript's 'setTimeout' to delay the inevitable.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why did the JavaScript developer get lost? Because they couldn't find their way through the 'callback hell'.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers always mix up dates? Because they can't stop `new Date()`-ing.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I used to be a Java developer, but I couldn't handle the 'NullPointerExceptions'. Now I'm a JavaScript developer, and I still can't handle the 'undefined'.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer functional programming? Because they don't like to share state secrets.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: A JavaScript variable walks into a function bar and asks for a drink. The bartender says, 'Undefined'. The variable replies, 'Not a problem, I'm flexible.'
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer JSON? Because they enjoy exchanging objects with strangers.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I don't always code in JavaScript, but when I do, I prefer arrow functions.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer coding at night? Because the dreams they encounter during sleep mode inspire their code.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why did the JavaScript developer quit their job? They didn't get 'prototype' clearance.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I asked JavaScript why it was single-threaded. It replied, 'I'm waiting for my promises to be fulfilled.'
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Why do JavaScript developers prefer to work alone? Because they don't like anyone meddling with
quotes.author: Unknown
